OakPAL features now in development or planning include:

First-class ACL Support: Forced Roots will be able to specify access control lists when creating paths in order to test AC Handling modes and workspace filter effects. An ExpectAces check will be provided by oakpal-core to assert the presence or absence of particular access control entries after package extraction.

Testing for Checklists and Opears: The oakpal core API and maven plugin will be enhanced to allow for declaring expected violations. Given a test package constructed to satisfy your check rules, you will be able to configure a maven scan that fails when specific violations aren't reported.

I18N for Violations: I, a myopic American, built an open source developer tool without i18n support on top of a stack of other tools that do have i18n support. This will be corrected in a future version.
